text.p: The European Commission said on Friday it had cleared the creation of a P&O Nedlloyd Container Line Ltd, a joint venture which will pool the deep-sea container shipping business of its parents, the Peninsular and Oriental Steam Navigation Company (P&O) and Royal Nedlloyd NV.
The Commission said the new company would be the third largest container operator in the world and the second-largest in Europe.
It said it had examined the effects of the joint venture on shipping routes from or to European ports where both P&O and Nedlloyd had container activities.
"The combined market share of P&O and Nedlloyd exceeds 20 percent only on the northern Europe-Australia/New Zealand route," it said in a statement.

The Commission said it had also considered the effect on liner conferences -- groups of vessel operators which apply uniform conditions on a route -- operating on the routes from or to European ports.
P&O is a member of all of the conferences operating on those routes and Nedlloyd of most of them.

"The Commission has considered that no dominance arises from the reduction of the number of members of any of the conferences on the routes examined or from the increase in the market share of a conference resulting from the merger." it said. -- Brussels Newsroom 32 2 287 6800
